abstract.t: This memo defines Object Security of CoAP (OSCOAP), a method for protection of request and response message exchanges of the Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP) using data object security. OSCOAP provides end-to-end encryption, integrity and replay protection to CoAP payload, options and header fields, and a secure binding between CoAP request and response messages. The use of OSCOAP is signaled with the Object-Security option, also defined in this memo.
